parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From hagiazo; properly, purification, i.e. purity; concretely a purifier.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
